Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Hi, I watched the video about the 5.1% rewards for holding KMD in Agama. It suggests using the lite version. Is it possible to also claim the rewards if you use the native one?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You can but the coins end up in change address, because hte Agama dev wont let you use -pubkey.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Thanks. What do you mean when you say "change address"?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
you have a physical wallet. with pockets.
got 100 note bill in 1
you buy/sell something. give that 100 bill to someone and get back 50, 20, 10 note bills.
this change doesn't go back to the same pocket you picked the 100 bill from. 
it always creates a new pocket, and puts these notes into it.
that new pocket creation is a "rule" in native mode only.
it is done by the native wallet, and not a human intervention.
this analogy should clear you what is change address.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
OK thanks for the explanation. Does it put all the KMD you have in a different pocket after claiming the reward, or just the rewards? 
Anyway, I think it doesn't make much difference if it's in a different pocket...as it's still inside my wallet.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes it doesnt mean you lose anyting, but it makes it harder to track. Also for the election, if all your KMD is spread over hundresds of change address's its a huge problem to cast your vote.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Ah OK I understand now, thanks for helping

Author: Mixic#3188
Content: https://twitter.com/sandero871152/status/1048441643429507072?s=19

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @D2D privacyalternatives.com you can also use native mode now. Native mode has an option to select address where the rewards will end up. Select the same address as you are claiming reward from

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Ah great, thanks

Content: now, look at PIRATE. the difference of PIRATE before and after dPoW. without it, it was an interesting test coin, but once it got it, then it becomes a viable contender in the privacy coin space. If the PIRATE chain is not secure, then it cant get a lot of interest.
